article: Christmas was always an amazing time in my home when l was growing up.My parents were not rich, but they were always _ when it came to giving us presents.Every year, they 12 _ a Christmas Eve party and gave all the kids in the neighborhood presents as well .  One year when I was eight years old,1 was hoping that I would14 _ a bike for Christmas.I made it clear in every way I knew to my _ .I left hints all over the place.On the Christmas morning, all the kids received present after present.16 _ we got to the end of presents,I was very _ .There was no bike for me.I cried, "Is that all?" The moment I _ it, I knew I had made a big _ .After my parents worked so hard, _ could I complain that I did not receive a bike when I had received so many other things? My father got up and went outside. He came back wheeling the bicycle that they had been _ to give me after all the other presents were _ .At that time, I felt even _ than before.How could I ever enjoy after that?  My parents _ me to think about how I felt the moment I saw that I had _ received the bike. They told me to remember that _ so that I would never repeat that mistake and feel that way again.  In the four years after that, at the _ of all the presents given, my father 29 _ ask me what I had to say to everyone.It had become a family _ .1 would always say, "Is that all?" But what I really meant was "Thank you so much".And everyone knew that.
